title: AP Top 25 Podcast: Over or under? Win totals for 2020 season
title_page: AP Top 25 Podcast: Over or under? Win totals for 2020 season
maintext:
AP Top 25 Podcast: Over or under? Win totals for 2020 season
FILE - In this March 12, 2020, file photo, Clemson football player Tee Higgins lifts weights during NFL Pro Day in Clemson, S.C. Scouts, front-office executives and even coaches find themselves coping with a whole new process with Americans hunkering down and doctors overwhelmed by the mounting cases of COVID-19. Gone for the most part this year are access to in-person interviews, campus workouts and visits to team headquarters. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro, File)
FILE - In this March 12, 2020, file photo, Clemson football player Tee Higgins lifts weights during NFL Pro Day in Clemson, S.C. Scouts, front-office executives and even coaches find themselves coping with a whole new process with Americans hunkering down and doctors overwhelmed by the mounting cases of COVID-19. Gone for the most part this year are access to in-person interviews, campus workouts and visits to team headquarters. (AP Photo/Richard Shiro, File)
Over or under?
Las Vegas oddsmakers have projected victory totals for every team in major college football from Clemson to Kansas.
On the latest AP College Football Top 25 Podcast, Chris Fallica of ESPN — aka The Bear from “College GameDay” — joins the AP’s Ralph Russo to give his early plays on what teams will exceed their projections or fall short.
Fallica is optimistic about a Big Ten team that had a disappointing 2019 and pessimistic about at least one Big 12 team that hasn’t been to a bowl in a while.
The Bear gives at least one lean in every FBS conference.
Also, Fallica discusses how he helps “GameDay” producers get a jump on where the show might be headed in the upcoming season.
___
Follow Ralph D. Russo at https://twitter.com/ralphDrussoAP and https://appodcasts.com/category/ap-top-25-college-football/
___
More AP college football: https://apnews.com/APTop25CollegeFootballPoll and https://apnews.com/Collegefootball and https://twitter.com/AP_Top25
